summary: This is a compilation of news clips from the Southern District of New York dated June 25, 2019. It covers various cases including public housing leadership (NYCHA), fraud cases (Pierce, Henning, Ceglia), public corruption (Calk), wildlife trafficking (Kromah), a kidnapping (Parmar), and an update on the Jeffrey Epstein case regarding the DOJ's defense of his 2007 plea deal.

persons.name: Gregory Russ
persons.context: Newly appointed head of the New York City Housing Authority, facing controversy over his salary and management approach using the RAD program.

persons.name: Courtney Gross
persons.context: Interviewed Gregory Russ about his new role at NYCHA.

persons.name: Bill de Blasio
persons.context: Mentioned in context of NYCHA's plans and his administration's embrace of the RAD program.

persons.name: Elizabeth Ann Pierce
persons.role: Former FCC Broadband Committee Chair, CEO of Quintillion
persons.context: Sentenced to five years in prison for defrauding investors by forging contracts to raise funds for a fiber network.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.role: U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Announced sentences and charges in multiple cases including Pierce, Kromah, Parmar, and Henning.

persons.name: Moazu Kromah
persons.context: Arrested for conspiracy to sell rhino horns and elephant ivory valued at $7.4 million, heading a large wildlife crime syndicate.

persons.name: Harbir Parmar
persons.context: Sentenced to three years in prison for kidnapping a female passenger and wire fraud for overcharging customers.

persons.name: Steven Henning
persons.context: Pleaded guilty to wire fraud for defrauding investors out of $2 million through a sham intellectual property company.

persons.name: Paul Ceglia
persons.context: Remains a fugitive after Ecuador denied U.S. extradition request; charged with trying to defraud Mark Zuckerberg.

persons.name: Stephen Calk
persons.context: Indicted for allegedly leveraging risky loans to Paul Manafort to try to obtain a Trump administration position.

persons.name: Paul Manafort
persons.context: Received loans from Stephen Calk's bank while Calk sought a Trump administration job.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of DOJ motion defending his 2007 non-prosecution agreement for sex abuse charges.

persons.name: Byung "B.J." Pak
persons.context: Filed motion arguing Epstein's plea deal must stand and victims have limited rights under the Crime Victims' Rights Act.

persons.name: Alexander Acosta
persons.role: Former U.S. Attorney, Secretary of Labor
persons.context: Engineered the 2007 non-prosecution agreement for Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned as allegedly recruiting women and underage girls for Epstein; has not been charged.

connections.description: Calk's bank made $16 million in risky loans to Manafort while Calk sought Manafort's help in obtaining a Trump administration job.
Maxwell is described as Epstein's partner in allegedly recruiting women and underage girls.
As U.S. Attorney, Acosta engineered the non-prosecution agreement that allowed Epstein to plead guilty to lesser state charges.
Alleged partners heading one of the largest wildlife crime syndicates in Africa.

events.title: SDNY News Clips Publication
events.description: Compilation of news articles covering various SDNY cases and matters.

events.title: Parmar Sentencing
events.description: Harbir Parmar sentenced to three years in prison for kidnapping an Uber passenger and wire fraud.

events.title: Henning Guilty Plea
events.description: Steven Henning pleaded guilty to wire fraud for defrauding investors out of $2 million.

events.title: Kromah Arrest
events.description: Moazu Kromah arrested in Uganda for wildlife trafficking and later appeared in a New York federal court.

events.title: Ceglia Extradition Denied
events.description: Ecuador's President Lenin Moreno denied U.S. extradition request for Paul Ceglia, who remains a fugitive.

events.title: Epstein Plea Deal
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein entered a non-prosecution agreement, pleading guilty to state prostitution charges and avoiding federal sex-trafficking charges.

events.title: DOJ Motion on Epstein Deal
events.description: U.S. Attorney B.J. Pak filed a motion arguing the 2007 Epstein plea deal must stand and victims have limited recourse.

keyFacts: The U.S. Department of Justice filed a motion defending Jeffrey Epstein's 2007 non-prosecution agreement, arguing victims have no right to demand its invalidation or a new prosecution.
Uber driver Harbir Parmar was sentenced to three years in prison for kidnapping a passenger by changing her destination to Boston while she slept and for wire fraud related to overcharging.
Chicago banker Stephen Calk was indicted for allegedly bribing Paul Manafort with $16 million in loans in exchange for help securing a Trump administration job.
Wildlife trafficker Moazu Kromah was arrested and faces charges for conspiring to sell $7.4 million worth of rhino horn and elephant ivory, representing over 1,000 elephants and 35 rhinos.
Former FCC broadband committee chair Elizabeth Ann Pierce was sentenced to five years in prison for defrauding investors of over $270 million using forged contracts.
